Restaurant has a nice hotel feel to it. It's nice and I think great for a business meal. However, service was very slow. Our server didn't check up on us and it took awhile to get the check.
author: Cindy Y.

description:
Came here for breakfast with clients, and we were very impressed with the food and service.  

However, the first pot of coffee tasted as though it had been on the heat too long, so we were given a new one.  Even with the new pot, their coffee was not amazing.  But, the food was delicious.  I had the egg white scramble, and the hint of spicy mustard was a great addition.

Our server was Damian Rodrigues, and he was wonderful.  We really enjoyed his suggestions and humor.  I don't usually make a point of naming specific staff, but Damian really stood out and made a good impression.
author: Stacy J.

description:
I visited TRACE for the Yelp Elite meet event.  The place seems a bit overbooked and crowded, but it was still a very cool experience.  The bar/lounge area is two stories and has a nice, cool, trendy-clubby-like vibe to it, yet seemed sophisticated.  

I tried out a couple of the mixed drinks, though my favorite by far was the "bee's knees" shot.  It was gin, honey and lemon.  So easy to drink, and so delicious.

Some of my favorite food samples included the pumpkin ravioli, pork should, and lamb with gnocchi.  

I know that they offer happy hour on weekdays, so hopefully I'll be able to come back sometime soon.
author: Samantha L.

description: Stayed at the W and was offered 20% off Trace. Couldn't pass up the offer so my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try. The food was nothing but amazing! We went all out! Had appetizers, drinks, dinner, and dessert. Great lighting and music.
author: Jess R.

description:
Decent breakfast; not super spectacular. 
But the evening bar service was great. Love the various flatbreads- very tasty.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Service is fantastic; had a small dinner here for my birthday last weekend. Yahya made me a special birthday drink (virgin) and a beautiful dessert plate decorated with Happy Birthday:) Dinner was good and the ambience is gorgeous here. I recommend!
author: Zainab B.

description:
I came to Trace as part of the amazing Yelp Elite Event party. I am impressed with everything from the ambiance, decoration, people, food and drinks. The food is definitely top notch. My particular favorites of the night are lamb shoulder with gnocchi and pumpkin ravioli. I can imagine myself eating the whole entrees. Free flow of drinks (cocktails, red wine, cava and beer) are great but we all should drink responsibly. 

Thank you Yelp and Trace for organizing such a fabulous party. You really set the bar high for 2013. I look forward to an exciting 2013 with Yelp Elite! And yes I will make sure I come back to eat at Trace.
author: Saran R.

description:
Had brunch here on Saturday morning.

+ I really liked that they changed up the look from the last time I was there. It felt like I was among the SF fog, but with a really good DJ.

+ The bacon waffles and Ahi salad was amazing! A definite to do. 

+ We must have just showed up after the big rush because we had no problem being seated and the manager came over and bought us a round of champagne. He was very attractive by the way. I think his name was Akop.

* It may be the champagne or the hot manager or the bacon but this place was awesome. If they would lower there room rates, I would absolutely stay here just so I could be closer to the bacon waffles. Either way, I will definitely return.
author: Brad M.

description:
I came here for brunch on a double date with Cathy Y. and the bfs.  We had a Travelzoo deal that gave us a great price for a brunch entree + cocktail.  I really liked the decor when we got there - it's very modern.  

Based on the voucher we had, we were only supposed to have three or four choices for brunch, but our server was very friendly and said they were flexible with what we could order so other brunch entrees were also allowed.  I was very impressed they were so flexible considering it was a pre-paid voucher, but that was about the end of what impressed me.

After we ordered, service was very slow and spotty.  One of our party never got the juice he ordered, one of the entrees that came out was not what we had ordered and it took about 20 minutes to even find waitperson to get our check.  The food was fine, pretty standard brunch fare with perhaps a nicer presentation that most places.  Perhaps service is better when you don't use a voucher, but I most likely won't go back to find out.
author: Liz H.

description:
My boyfriend and I ate at Trace and thought it was great. The service was impeccable: there was someone to fill your glass, refill your bread, fold your napkin, serve the food, etc...  The food was also delicious. 
We had the Yellowtail, oysters and liver mousse for starters. All three were fabulous. For entrees we had the seabass and the steak, again there wasn't a single complaint. After all of that food, we also had some yummy coffee drinks to aid in the digestion.  
The only negatives of the experience were that there was construction, so you had to go outside and then come back in to a different part of the restaurant in order to use the restroom. Also, the music was very loud, so it wasn't ideal for good conversation.
author: Alycia N.

description: Surprisingly good burger only outdone by the cocktails and wait staff.
author: James R.

description:
Impressed as we walked in, Ambiance is modern with silver, black and white colors, and it's in W Hotel. FOOD !  We must have come on a a bad day. Salad soaked in vinegar, so sour, pumpkin soup taste like Gerber baby food, entree pork loin is tender but tasteless.
I'm giving 3 stars for superb service otherwise it's down to 1.
author: Marites C.

description: Trace needs a new chef. I was ill for a few days. Staff very friendly. They also give parties and the music was extremely loud. Will not go there again.
author: Marguerite G.

description:
This is the revamped of the previous XYZ inside the W hotel. They did a great job with the atmosphere, very hip, young and modern like the W always holds to provide. 

Came here for Dine-About-Town lunch, left feeling pretty upset and pissed off about the service we received. 

The server never introduced herself, she looked annoyed that my boyfriend and I were sat in her section. She actually did not say a single word to us. I had to tell her we were ready to order our drinks. The drinks, didn't come for over 20 minutes (I'm sure of this, I timed it. I even stood up to go to the bar to pick it up myself. She finally came by for us to tell her that we were still waiting for it.) 

She took our order, didn't say a single word. The food took a while to come and a food runner brought it over, our starter came first, the Chicken Liver Mousse. We had no plates, server no where to be found, I had to flag down someone else to get us plates. 

Waited longer for our entrees to come, our server finally brought it out and just left it on the table, didn't ask us if we needed anything else, just plopped it down and left. She did not once come by to check in on us during our meal. She walked by plenty of times, didn't give a shit. 

Mind you, there are two other tables next to us. One 3 white businessmen, they seemed satisfied with her service, she was much nicer to them, she checked in, she chatted. Another table that was sat after we had already begun our starter, 2 white men, 1 white woman, the server was speaking to them, laughing with them, making sure they were getting great service. Brought out the wine for them to try immediately, their first dish came out within 10 minutes of sitting down. 

At first, I was telling myself, "ok, maybe she's having a bad day" but after seeing how she serviced and interacted with the other two tables, made me think that maybe she though "oh no, a young asian couple, they're probably going to do DAT and not tip well, so I won't bother".

Hey, guess what ma'am, we may be younger than the other business people dining in the restaurant, but I am no way a cheap tipper nor will I give you any trouble, I just want to be treated with respect like everyone else. I want the same goddamn dining experience everyone else is having. 

And you know what, even after the shitty service you gave us, I still gave you a decent tip. 

Yes, my angry rant isn't just a rant, I let the manager know. I pulled the race card, I tried to be empathetic in case she was having a bad day, but honestly, she ruined what was supposed to be a nice lunch out. And the manager's response: "will you be coming back to dine with us? I apologize, I promise next time will be better" Yea ok, sure, not like you care or will do anything about it. 

You want to know how the food was, it was ok. You can dine anywhere else in the city and get the same quality if not better for the same price. So if I had a choice to pick between Trace or another restaurant, I would pick the latter. 

Thank you for an amazing experience.
author: Anh P.

description:
Here are the facts: 

$13 Cocktails

$11 Well drinks

Trendy

Older crowd

No Happy hour

Weak drinks

You wanna go here now?
author: emily f.

description:
Great food. Amazing waiter. 
We stayed at The W hotel here and ate at Trace last night after a long day of touring the city.  Our waiter, Roger, eclipsed the food, which was great also. Roger is a rare waiter than brings life to a menu with his personal recommendations as taste suggestions. My wife is vegetarian, I am not. We tried the Heirloom Tomato Salad, which was great with the house-made farmers cheese. She ordered the vegetarian Organic Grains dish and was very happy. I had the Oysters and the Pork Shoulder Gnocchi. Decadent and very good. Rogers suggestions on the beer choices were even spot on! Would definitely come back, especially if you don't mind following a great waiter's lead.
author: DJ T.

description: I did not realized that TRACE was inside the W Hotel, the ambiance of the restaurant is modern, elegant and classy. Services was incredible - I had two different waitress helping em and a third person serving bread, water was being refilled throwout the whole evening. The food was cooked to perfection, we had sirloin steak and suck and the meat was tender and juicy. For dessert we had the carrot cake that does not taste like carrot cake and throwout the whole evening I was drinking Rose Pedal cocktail that was light and oh so yummy.
author: Magda G.

description: Came here with my wife and 2 nieces. Had an amazing night!!!! Unbelievable service from Roger. He is one of the best waiters I have ever had serve me. He was excellent, well informed and very honest with his recommendations. We had the chicken liver mouse which I would never have ordered but Roger insisted and it was amazing. The best thing I have eaten in a long time. We did the pasta appetizer and it was great as well as the beet salad and the risotto was perfect. Was as good as any I had recently when we were in Italy. For entrees we had the scallops...my favorite of the three, The sauce on the angel hair pasta was amazing. I had the sea bass which was great and the sauce was killer too. It was a great night. The manager came by and was very friendly and thorough. Everyone here seems to take great pride in this restaurant. We will  be back real soon.
author: Sean M.

description: I've been passing by Trace for a while now and I finally decided that it was time to give it a try.  We went there for breakfast and it was pretty early (our newborn couldn't sleep).  The attention from the waiter was great until we wanted to get our check which took a long time.  I ordered the french toast and it was alright but the overall prices for what we got was pretty expensive so I'm not sure I'd be back since there are so many cheaper and tastier breakfast spots in the city.
author: Blake B.

description: Incredible food and service! Unbelievable taste sensations! We had the fruit, cheese and honey plate mastered by in-house bee keeper Roger. A San Francisco hidden gem a must go if you are in the area.
author: Neil B.

description:
Decided to eat here because we were staying at the W hotel anyway, felt jet lagged, and hungry. 

Friendly and attentive staff EXCEPT for our waiter.  The hostess greeted us cheerfully, seated us, and poured us water.  The food runner made sure we had our drinks, meals, and bread.  The waiter took FOREVER to take our order, didn't ask how things were, and then took FOREVER to get us the dessert menu.  

The food was okay.  Got the raw oysters, which were super fresh and yummy.  I ordered the braised pork shoulder as my entree and was not impressed.  Although the meat was tender, it was too salty. I also got to try the chicken, which was crispy with nice flavor. Dessert was okay as well.  We had the avocado ice cream and the panna cotta - both were good.
author: Den F.

description: Great Service.... Roger, was excellent, very friendly . The food is fresh and delicious !!The top roof honey is great and you have to try the Strawberry Basil Lemonade !!!!
author: Lily N.

description:
Okay, this place may be good for dinner, but brunch was a serious disappointment.  My roommates, who love coming here for dinner, took me out here to celebrate my recent employment.  I want to believe that Trace uses brunch hours to train their new staff because they pretty much screwed everything up.  Coffee came without sugar, cream, or spoons to mix with.  After pouring the coffee, the waiter just plopped the container right in front of my friend.  Least to say, she was not too pleased.  To make matter worst, they also brought out the wrong plate for my friend and we had to wait an additional 15 minutes for his plate to arrive.  Sloppy and unprofessional.  

And this isn't just a review based on their service.  I'm not that stupid.  We had the french toast, waffles, and trace egg sandwich.  The food was nothing to write home about neither.  Definitely needs improvement.
author: Michael L.

description: The eggs benedict i got was pretty good. My friend reallly liked her scrambled eggs. Not a bad breakfast place inside a hotel.
author: Diane H.

description: Trace is what happens when a chic hotel decides to do "farm to table."  The bathroom for the restaurant customers became inaccessible when the restaurant turned into a nightclub during dinner hours.  There was actually a bouncer standing inside a velvet rope who refused to let me use the bathroom.  The food and service were pretty good, but for the price and the air of exclusivity they exude, it should be a lot better.
author: Ryan F.

description:
The last time I went here....The service was atrocious...The waitress didn't really talk to my party (It was my 23 birthday) and they messed up our orders about 3 times. They did not bring mimosas which I had made a request for when we first sat down. 
I would recommend the Trace Burger! But only if you get it to go! Because if I were you I wouldn't go anywhere near the W Trace restaurant. Risking the terrible service you might have to indulge if you do stay.
author: Gigi M.

description: Amazing food, atmosphere and service. Roger made our anniversary extra special! Would definitely recommend this restaurant to someone else. We will be dining here again!
author: Adam W.

description:
Part of W Hotel
San Francisco
Have "Remix" brunches on weekends
4 entrees w/"drink" pairings:
Tasty pizza (non-cheese) w/spicy Bloody Mary
Waffles
Ricotta pancakes w/sour lemonade drink
Food service was just okay; bus service was friendly & very helpful
Hotel being remodeled; slight hassle
High noise level; heavy beat music
Trendy
Won't come back
author: Rosquete B.

description:
3.5 stars 

I had breakfast and a light snack here. I attest that the food is absolutely delicious. Breakfast portion was spectacular that I decided to come by for din-din, I was not let down. Everything is fresh and of superior quality. Trace's lamb meatballs are a must! I wished they could have added some more balls, as it was too good.  

My only gripe was the bread service, I had to wait a while for balsamic to arrive. Also, it would have been great if they provided freshly baked bread, as their aim is to provide local/sustainable products. Pricing is reasonable for the calibre of food being served.
author: Arya S.

description: A friend organized brunch here so we could try it out.  It was rather empty, so while it was great for getting a table for 10 it lacked warmth.  Having said that, we were all pleasantly surprised by our food, which we really enjoyed.  We had the eggs benedict (poached eggs and prosciutto with arugula and hollandaise), the Trace burger (both were excellent) while others had the chicken sandwich (good) and pancakes. With juices and coffee it ended up at 30 per person including the 18% gratuity. Worth revisiting.
author: Vivian W.

description:
I had breakfast at Trace for the first time today. I must say I was disappointed. To start with I had requested a window table on Open Table and the hostess mentioned that when we checked in but stated they were very busy that morning and everyone wanted window tables. Maybe so, but everyone didn't have reservations. They had plenty of table available and rarely fill up for breakfast so I think the fact that I had a reservation should have resulted in their saving a table for me by the window. 

As for the food itself, I ordered the Trace which was eggs, toast, bacon, and potatoes. My wife had an omelette with mushrooms and gruyere cheese and peppers. I had expected the Trace would be similar to the Plow at Plow and it looked the same on paper but that was it. The eggs were fine but the bacon was thin and dry with no taste of applewood. Not that it claimed to be applewood but I expect that for a $15 plate. The toast was uninspiring and served overcooked AND cold. Not sure how you accomplish that. My wife ordered a decaf coffee and I ordered a regular coffee and we were served from the same pot so I had to call the waiter on it. He apologized and brought another pot of regular for me. I must say the coffee was delicious though. The omelette was also uninspiring and the potatoes were pretty but land  

I've eaten at W in SF when the restaurant was called XYZ and I much preferred the food and interior. The new interior is pretentious and looks like all the furniture was sourced by K&D. 

Overall I much preferred XYZ and i really can't understand why W invested so much time and money in this mediocre remodel.
author: Johnny O.

description:
More like 3.5 stars.

We came here for Dine About Town this past Sunday upon seating they gave us the regular menu but not the Dine About Town menu.  We asked for it which the waiter was kind of enough to bring over.  We ordered a few things to share; chicken liver mousse, cauliflower soup, yellow tail salad and a croque monsieur.  The food was pretty good, the soup could have been hotter, the salad could have been bigger but other than that no complaints.  

Trace is the renovated restaurant that used to be XYZ.  They have opted for more of a casual feel from what was more I believe a sophisticated, classy feel.  The vibe is still the same, it's still very much like a W Hotel which means it has the club like atmosphere.  Overall I was a bit disappointed because even though I never thought the food at XYZ was good, I feel this is a step down from what it used to be in terms of overall experience.  

Service was good, waiter was friendly and the hostess felt snobbish but that could have been me.

I would come back and give it another try but the regular menu isn't inexpensive since it is the W Hotel after all which means that there are many other places to eat at that price range.
author: Pierre L.

description:
Review for breakfast: scrambled egg whites (roasted sweet peppers, arugula pesto, walnut bread crispy Yukon gold potatoes,  soy breakfast sausage)

I really enjoyed this healthy meal to start off the day. The meal was not salty (like many scrambled eggs prepared in restaurants) and the portion size was perfect.  

This place is appropriate for business meetings.
author: Jister Y.

description: Amazing. Came here for restaurant week. $40 per person including a glass of wine. The booths are secluded and very high end. Definitely recommend if you're in the area. Loved it!
author: Ana J.

description: The host welcomed us and brought us to our seats.  Sierra (not sure if that is the correct spelling) was our waitress.  She was great, friendly, gave us excellent food and wine recommendations, and she had the perfect balance of checking in with us and giving us our privacy.  The other staff also made sure we had bread, and our water glasses were never empty.  Our compliments to the chefs as well.  The food was delicious: fried brussel sprouts, beet salad, flat bread, dungeness crab, risotto.  All were tasty.
author: Evan P.

description: Excellent poached eggs and prosciutto, it comes eggs benedict style.  Yum!  Delicious latte, yummy croissant, the 'pop tart' was ok (tasted more like a toaster strudel lol.  Kind of hoped it'd be better) and the mimosa was lovely.  Service was good and we overall had a lovely breakfast!
author: Ash M.

description:
40 minutes and the cocktail server couldn't get us 2 glasses of wine. It was not that busy. When we hunted down our server to cancel the order, there wasn't so much as a sorry. But she was able to put $50 hold on my credit card which is still pending 3 days later. 

Don't bother.
author: Christy Z.

description:
Extremely underwhelming. 

Service was rushed, but also super slow, if that makes any sense. It was lunch time and it didn't look very busy, but the server took a while before she came over, hastily took our orders, and didn't manage to make any of the dishes sound enticing. Food also came out very s l o w, and they also forgot our appetizers. However, we did get them on the house, which was nice. 

Food was mediocre. I got the rabbit club. The rabbit was more like a pate, which I found weird. The grilled flat bread appetizer - when we finally got it - was good. We also got a bunch of desserts to try - with the peanut butter waffle being the most popular. I thought it was just okay though.

To top it all off, the waitress gave us the wrong bill. Why so frazzled?
author: Priscilla T.

description: I was a guest at The W Hotel and decided to have brunch here on a Saturday. The service was 2 stars because the hosts and the servers didn't know anything about their special HH drink menu for during brunch between 11AM to 1PM(?). It took us a long time to even get a glass of water on the table to begin with. Food was OK - the best was the pancakes (but I love pancakes). They were out of the special bacon that they put in the bloody mary's - which I find odd - especially if you are a full service restaurant serving hotel guests (room service) and open to the public. Nonetheless, the bloody mary was what's holding me from giving them only 2 stars because it was wonderfully balanced. Overall, for a hotel restaurant - it has a lot to live up to.
author: Ruby B.

description:
I had dinner at Trace last week.  All-in-all very good.  As mentioned in other reviews it's loud as it's open to the upper bar area, but it's a W after all.  :)

A friend and I shared items from the small plates menu.  The salad and Tuna Tartare were excellent.  The meats of the Charcuterie board tasted a little bit over-seasoned, but we enjoyed it none the less.

Trace has a surprisingly small wine list for San Francisco and their prices are a bit high.....but it's a W after all!

I will definitely visit Trace again.
author: Bob B.

description:
couldn't get any sleep so i made my way here for brekkie with a friend.  it was one of those days where you have to wear your shades indoors without the olsen twins' credentials.

trace was an easy spot for brunch as my friend was on their way to the airport.

got coffee pronto! including 2 re-fills...and with it some serious food coma grub: chilaquiles and eggs bennie.  devoured it all without licking the plate.  

- the eggs bennie come with arugula and prosciutto with a side of potato.  deelish! the hollandaise was just perfect and didn't drown out the rest of the ingredients.
- the chilaquiles were topped with fresh avocado and a slice of lime.

service was awesome.  loved the partitions - gave you some sort of privacy for deep but fashionable convo.
author: Anh V.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised by Trace.  went for a Dine-about-town lunch (solid Pate, Yellowtail salad, Croque, etc) and really enjoyed all the food.   

The space is very cool, very good service (Joey was great!) and fun food choices.

I usually avoid hotel restaurants, but I'd go back to Trace.
author: Java Z.

description:
I just had one of the best breakfast's ever. It was billed as steak and eggs, but was better than I'd expected. It was perfectly cooked and an amazing combination of "goodies" under the steak slices - fingerling potatoes that were naturally sweet, heirloom tomatoes that were lightly sautéed with some tender green onion slices, a few mild pepper pieces that were slightly spicy, and sprinkled with micro arugula. I had my eggs over easy and they were perfect. There was also a small cup of hollandaise. 

I love breakfast and this was definitely a keeper, and worth a few do overs ... and happy to recommend.
author: Randy S.

description: We were staying at the Marriott and the concierge recommended a couple of places for brunch on Sunday of Memorial Day weekend. One of them was Trace. Never before have I experienced such appalling rudeness from a business that ostensibly wants my money. We walked in for brunch to see the place was virtually empty. When we asked for a table for two the hostess said there would be a wait of at least 15 minutes (we waited for almost 1/2 hour before leaving). When I inquired why we would have to wait to be seated in a virtually empty restaurant, this person so very condescendingly informed me she was short-staffed. I said no problem, please just seat us and we'll wait. This person refused to do so, and again being horrifically rude said we could wait at the bar, which was closed. So we waited. And waited some more. I was just about ready to go ask again why we were still waiting, when somebody walked in from the street, no reservation, and was seated immediately. WTF? When I asked the Manager what the problem was with seating us, he gave some lame answer. When I replied that the hostess said it was because they were short-staffed, he said that was not the case at all. Then what was the case? No good answer was given. All I know is we'll never go back again. My advice is to stay away - these people are complete jerks.
author: Don G.

description:
The first thing that caught my eye was of course, the name. :)  A combination of great yelp reviews and the fact that it's right across the street from my office brought me in to eat. 

First things first - 
I love love love the decor here! I want to LIVE in Trace! Silvery grey curtains, black metal partitions and walls of silver beads separated eating spaces, giving it a more intimate feeling. Between the white perforated leather chairs, slick white tables and blue up-lighting, you get a very modern and sexy atmosphere. 

I had the Trace Burger (medium rare) and an iced tea. This was possibly the BEST burger I have ever had. It was closer to medium than rare, which is my preference and SO JUICY. The burrata was delicious, the bun was toasted and buttery and the fingerling potatoes were a nice upgrade from fries (which were also an option.) Needless to say i was stuffed and beyond satisfied when i left. lol

I didn't have time to explore the Upstairs Drink Boutique or Living Room Bar since it was just a quick lunch break, but i canNOT wait to come back for a late dinner and  drinks!
author: Tracee J.

description:
Trace is super cool. I took one of my best friends here when she came for a visit and it was my first time going there as well. We didn't go for dinner or food, which I think is mainly on the first floor when you enter. 

But if you want to go somewhere that is very chill, has some decent drinks and friendly service this is a great spot to check out. The bar/lounge upstairs has a very cool vibe with a bar top that lights up a variety of different colors and then there are private tables for bigger groups too. Our bartender was very attentive and recommended some great stuff and even gave us a complimentary round.

It wasn't crowded at all, but all the seats were taken. So it was lively without being annoying. I wouldn't say that it is a place to necessarily meet new people if that is what you are looking for, but take your friends here and you should have a good time. We did!
author: Luke O.

description:
The food was super good, but it's a little too pricey for what we got.

The space is great, the service is very good and the food was good.

We had raw oysters and pork belly pizza as appetizers, and then I had honey something pork chop with spaetzle. 

I probably wouldn't eat here agin unless I, either had a friend staying at the W, or I was staying there myself.
author: Gerardo C.

description: Excellent service.  Food is yummy. Our waiter is funny and when I asked to make my bloody mary stiff, it sure was!!! I really enjoyed the salmon and bagel plate. And we got donuts filled with nutella.  Just for checking in with having 2 meals.  NICE!!!!
author: Rex B.

description: The W tried hard to make Trace a cool restaurant instead of the hotel coffee shop breakfast restaurant.  I had the travelzoo 3-courses dinner with cocktails pairing deal.  First course was the ginger carrot soup with pork belly bites, super tasty!  The main was grass fed steak, which was cooked well.  Cocktails ($15) were always great at the W.   Overall a fun night with pretty good food.  But without the deal the dinner would be $100 a person before tips and tax.  So it might be a little overpriced.  Wait for the next deal I will recommend to check out the restaurant.
author: Edmond T.

description:
Two lunches at Trace one OK, the other whatever.  The OK:  crispy(!) gnocchi with pork shoulder, velvety and delicious.  The other was their Pork Belly BLT and tuna tartare, both served with house-made pickles.  While the BLT's yellow tomatoes were visually stunning, they were on the bland side and the sandwich bread was borderline fragile.

Glacial service, good if you've got the time and you don't want to be bothered, but I felt abandoned once the entree came.
author: Seth G.

description: I came here for dinner with a girlfriend.  The lemon grass martini was refreshing and not sweet. The salmon was DELICIOUS and the berry sorbet ended the night beautifully.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Veronica S.

description: We visited TRACE as our 'fancy' dinner while on a little vacation to San Fran. Whatever other folks may say our experience was outstanding and the food was prepared to perfection. Our server was a pro and we could see he really cared about our food and experience at the restaurant. Bonus--we happened to be there on a night when DJ Celeste was spinning in the bar--very much recommended!
author: Dave W.

description:
I love the lit up bar!  I was drawn to it right when I walked in.  I also like how it's dark inside even though it's not so dark outside.  People tend to look better in low lighting. :P  Coming here for happy hour after the remodel took me by surprise. The bartenders are nice and attentive and the drinks are still a couple of dollars more than other places but I guess someone has to pay for the remodel.

Can't say much about the food because we didn't have any.  I will definitely come back.
author: Rosalind S.

description: I was pleasantly surprised with our meal here. I wasn't "WOW'd", but it was yummy. We started with the oysters, which were delicious. I'm a sucker for good, fresh oysters and TRACE did not disappoint. I had the summer squash salad, which was nothing to write home about, but was ok (how can you mess up cut up pieces of squash, mission figs, and avocado with a bit of dressing?). My husband ordered the beet salad which was A-MAZING. It was sweet, earthy and the burrata was creamy and delicious. I was a bit annoyed he didn't want to switch salads . Ha! He ordered the duck, which I didn't try. I had the scallops which were cooked to perfection and the angel hair tamari/uni sauce was DELICIOUS! I had a couple glasses of the Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc which was solid. Overall, it was a good experience with attentive service that was not overbearing.
author: Lori M.

description: Went here for a work lunch, it was great, nicely lit and great for big groups. I ordered a mushroom flat-bread and pulled pork gnocchi. I have to say while it was really good I was expecting more of a punch of flavor, especially for the gnocchi.
author: Analisa S.

description: Feeling hungry and looking for a nice place to dine we've found trace when we drove next to the w hotel. My wife said we should check this place. I started with the beat salad which isn't worth the money ( I mean it's just a salad) and also had the bean soup which was one of the best soups that I had this year. The server was very nice and overall I had a good experience . I would come back again
author: Jhony L.

description:
This place use to be the old XYZ. I guess they changed owners? 
I came here since they are on the dine about town selections. 
Sadly i checked out their online menu selection. I was so excited about their desert. 
Once i got to the restaurant i looked a the menu and the desert was not the same as the one i saw online. I was kinda bummed. 
However the waiter was really nice and told me everything is seasonal and changed and i can understand that.
The restaurant is super pretty and it has that "vegas" feel. The food overall was really good. I had their salad and chicken and almond pudding.
author: Smiley H.

description: Went to lunch this Overcast Saturday.  The service was helpful and friendly. My friend had the ox tail soup and said it was hot and tasty.  I had the pear and beet salad and that was really good. We had their signature chicken Fulton Sandwich,  The chicken was breast only and was really moist and delicious it came with jalapenos , I told them to hold the Aioli, don't like Aioli. Once served the service was sort of slow.  Didn't have a lot of options on the menu. Saturday is Brunch so mostly breakfast, eggs, waffles, etc. If you have a hankering for Saturday breakfast  this would be the place to go. Otherwise i probably won't go back.  The hotel "W"  is nice enough.
author: Susie S.

description:
The service has gone dramatically downhill since last year's remodeling. 

We're local, and pretty much every visit has some fundamental oversight. Whether it's inattentive, forgetful service or a ruined Benedict, Trace has gone from a favorite weekend brunch to an endless chain of disappointment.
author: Michael F.

description: Amazing deal through Gilt City- starter, entree, and dessert with wine or cocktail pairings. My friend and I went with the cocktails, and they were full size. That alone was worth the voucher. I got the onion oxtail soup, chicken entree, and chocolate dessert. My friend got the scallop entree and bread pudding. All solid, and even though I was taking it slow, I still couldn't finish all 3 cocktails. Definitely very happy with the experience.
author: Audrey T.

description: This place gets a four-star because the design of the restaurant looks cool and it's inside the W Hotel. I like the little blocked off areas with walls to give privacy as well. Service was quite slow....even though there were not too many folks there eating.  Food, as expected, is pricey.  I had a plate with three buttermilk pancakes that cost $13. The quality of course was high, but $13 for three pancakes?  What I really enjoyed was the hot tea.  This restaurant does not skimp on the quality of the tea.
author: Vivy C.

description:
Today I signed up for yelp only to give this place a  bad review.  After being seated for breakfast, it took a long time for my server to greet me.  I ordered the omelet, which was pretty tasty, however that is about all the good I have to say about this place.  The service was horrible.  I was not served any water for a good 10-15 minutes, actually my coffee beat the water to the table.  As for the coffee, it was never refilled nor was the water.  (5.50 for one cup of coffee is ridiculous) I finished my meal not having anything to drink throughout it.  My server even approached my table and didn't fill either of my drinks.  

On top of the horrible service, my meal was 27 dollars after tip.  I suggest walking another block down the road and going to the Grove for breakfast.  At least there you are not paying for full service and don't expect it.  Even though the food is good, it's not worth the money due to the service.  Throughout my meal I watched a number of tables experiencing this same disappointment.  Either they need a couple more severs per shift or they need to let the one I had go.  He completely ruined my overpriced breakfast.  Needless to say I will not be back.
author: Andrew S.

description: Food is very good. Service is beyond excellent! Was looking for a light dessert and when I put the menu down the server noticed that I seemed dissapointed and asked what I was looking for. I mentioned something like fresh berries, he said no problem and voila...out they came.
author: Tania S.

description: Pretty decent happy hour specials.  Nothing amazing.  I hadn't been here in awhile; I feel like the seats used to be black but now everything is white.  Despite looking pretty modern and new, having decent cocktails and small bites, and being at a decent location, nothing really draws me for return visits, other than being told that is where we're meeting for drinks.
author: Erika C.

description:
Alright, Trace, sorry I'm late.

I came to the Yelp party at Trace last week and wow, what a show. Trace was all sorts of classy and delicious that night. Wine pairings with delicate yellowtail and pumpkin ravioli appetizers served by an equally scrumptious looking waiter (seriously). They also had a finger foods buffet with some exciting options outlined below:

- Yellowtail with green goddess, pickled cucumber and toasted almond - OH. MY. GOD. I think I selfishly had like 3 of these. They were melt-in-your-mouth delicious.
- Heirloom Pumpkin Agnolotti with brown butter and TRACE rooftop honey. Paired with Push Back Sauv Blanc - If I could have selfishly had a bunch of these, I would have, but they ran out. The ravioli was made in house and quite stellar. I'll definitely make it back to Trace just for this dish. Additionally, I really enjoyed the Sauv Blanc that they served with it. I'll have to check them out next time I'm in Napa.
- Crispy Berkshire Pork Belly with beluga lentils and broccoli rabe
- Braised Lamb Shoulder with potato gnocchi
- HAPA SF's Lumpia with sweet & sour chili
- Bacon Bacon's Mini Cobb with triple b's, avocado, Pt. Reyes blue, bacon jam vinaigrette
- Taco Guys Squash Taco with crema and toasted ginger - LURVED this.
- Brass Knuckle's Pork with gangnam pork bun bite - Highly reviewed/enjoyed by other yelpers.

- Creme Fraiche Panna Cotta wtih satsuma tangerine
- Nitrogen Ice Cream Bar with honey ice cream - the honey is made on their rooftop. Like how much more can you ask for??

It was a truly wonderful event and the folks at Trace popped out near the end with "solid cocktails" (read: jello shots). Thanks so much for having us and I can't want to come back for more grub!
author: Raina B.

description: Restaurant was practically empty but service was slow - took one hour to get the entrees. Food was pretty good but overpriced. Steaks were overcooked - two people in our group ordered medium rare but got medium.
author: Jessica A.

description: Was very pleasantly surprised by our first meal at Trace. Our waiter was superb - all the staff were - and his recommendations about the menu were spot-on. The food was fantastic - every single dish!  The oysters and the chicken liver mousse in particular, as well as our entrees - we tried the halibut, salmon and fazzoletti pasta dishes. The desserts were also wonderful -the avocado ice cream, the chocolate creme bar with stout ice cream and finally the carrot cake - all delicious!  It was my husband's birthday and I simply noted it in the Open Table reservation and they treated him like family from the moment we arrived- everyone wished him well throughout the night - it was very sweet and memorable!  We will absolutely return soon!
author: Jessica T.

description: Really good food, though it is overpriced beyond the value of the food.   Recommend the owners either increase the portion sizes or cut the prices slightly.    In the end, great food, but not entirely worth the money.
author: Dan P.

description:
Stopped in at Trace a couple of Fridays ago to take advantage of a groupon-type deal that was expiring. Cannot stress enough how great our service was, how delicious the food was, and how much I enjoyed the $2 special martinis on the menu every Friday. 

I sadly can't remember our server's name, but she very graciously put up with two girls getting tipsy at lunch and paying with a coupon and was very friendly and helpful.   I had a delicious poached pear salad and my friend had an oxtail soup she said was great. But the pork gnocchi dish was so good, we both stopped talking for a few minutes to better shovel food in our mouths. Do I need to wax poetic on the beauty of a $2 cocktail?  No, probably not, because it was just that beautiful.  

If you work in the FiDi and can spare an hour for lunch (service is quick enough to get in and out, but I like to enjoy my martini lunch like a working lady), I highly recommend Trace.
author: Sarah W.

description:
I wanted to take my ladylove out for a night on the town, and per a good friend's recommendation, I decided to take her to Trace. Located at the W Hotel in the heart of SOMA, it's truly a great place to enjoy some city atmosphere. I had made a reservation, and when we arrived we were greeted by a friendly hostess who seated us right away. The space is hip, modernly dressed in gray-scale, with wide open space by the big street-facing windows, and sweet little nooks near the bar. 

After a brief consultation with our friendly server, Nathan, we decided to go with a prix fixe dinner complete with wine pairing. It's hard to go wrong with chef's choice at a fine establishment. Some of the dishes had more subtlety to their pairings, like the yellow tail with green goddess dressing (but oh how the almonds made that dish pop! Brilliant!), but even those had fresh notes that whet my appetite as we dove deeper into the night. The roasted asparagus had a meyer lemon "relish" that was incredible. The English pea agnolotti was light, sweet, and creamy (one of my favorite dishes). The Liberty Farm duck breast (skin perfectly rendered) came with an outrageously flavorful and tender sweet potato gnocci. My favorite dish was the pork tenderlion with fennel and spatzel. This tenderloin was perfectly cooked, flavorful and melt in my mouth. The spatzel was the best I've ever had. The pairing of the three sang beautiful melodies in my mouth. All of the wine pairings suggested by our server were also spot on. Though we took our time eating, when the dessert came several hours later, we were still so full that we weren't sure we could bite into anything else. Of course, when chocolate stout "pot de creme" bar is placed right under my nose, there's no way I can resist just a lick. Well, that was enough to entice me to take a few bites. Smooth, super chocolatey, with a little of that stout bitterness - delightful. 

I found the servers to be friendly, well-informed, and extremely attentive. The food was definitely a hit, and the wine took the whole experience over the top. I highly recommend giving yourself over to the chef's choice and enjoying the ride.
author: Shannon F.

description: By far one if my best dining experiences in awhile, Trace provided excellent service and food. My friends and I were well taken care of. Our waitress gave great suggestions from the wine list, but she also went above and beyond and suggested wines not listed in the menu. She provided me with chance to taste a dessert wine before I ordered a glass. Everyone was friendly, well-informed, and quietly attended to all of our needs without being intrusive in our conversation. The food was delicious. I had the polenta and veggie dish. Not only was there a hearty serving size, but the taste was exceptional. I only wish that I had more room for dessert. The decor is modern and our seating area provided an intimate atmosphere. I hope to visit this place a second time. If my dining experience mirrors my first, then I would be willing to include the additional start.
author: Rob N.

description: Love this place. Great service, great food and fabulous cocktails. I think it gets overlooked because it's a "hotel restaurant" but I've had nothing but good experiences here.
author: Jeska D.

description: Good atmosphere for a business lunch. A bit fancy and expensive, but the food was great and it wasn't crowded at all. The braised pork shoulder appetizer was absolutely amazing. The tuna salad is also very good.
author: Matt J.

description:
The place was empty.  I think there was one other table eating.  It looks like swish venue but definitely lacked atmosphere.  

The waiter was trying hard (too hard really: you don't need to refill my wine glass EVERY time I have a sip) but I no amount of smiling and congeniality was going to make up for the horrific lack of atmosphere. 

I had the papardelle with lamb.  Pasta was overcooked, lamb was just kind of thrown in there.  The whole dish was greasy with way too much oil or fat.  And it desperately needed seasoning.  It was the temperature of molten lava too, which I always find odd how some restaurants manage to get food that hot on a hob....I know I can't.  

The roast chicken was less successful.  3 small, 1-inched sized pieces of chicken (bones included) and a lot of green beans.  Disappointing.

So now you know why the place is empty.  I won't be back.
author: Steven R.

description:
We had a great  brunch at Trace:  from excellent customer service to delicious steak and eggs and peach lemonade!  

Five star experience.   Will go back :)
author: Judy L.

description: I ate at this restaurant on 06/05/12 for Dine About and I was totally blown out of the water!!!  I had the Chicken Liver Mousse to start -to die for!!!!  I had the sauteed King Salmon entre -so tender and over fava bean risotto with english pea puree that was INCREDIBLY tasty!  I had the Chocolate creme bar wich had stout ice cream and  oatmeal crumble -OMG I thought I died and went to heaven.  This meal was outstanding, the atmosphere classy and I WILL RETURN!!!  By the way, our waiter was pleasant and very personable.  :)
author: Anthony C.

description: Had a simple breakfast here - bran muffin, fruit and coffee.  Great service, clean and professional.  Would go here again and maybe try something harder to make next time.
author: H. H.

description: I recently went to a private event at Trace. I tried about half a dozen things, and I have to say, the food was pretty good. The standouts for me were the braised pork shoulder (with crisp gnocchi, mushrooms, and pecorino) which was positively delicious, and the heirloom pumpkin ravioli. Both were nicely balanced in terms of flavor and had a lovely mix of textures. I particularly loved the crunchy element on the ravioli.  I also really liked the cocktails. My favorite was a tequila concoction called El Diablo that was made with Tequila and some house made habanero syrup. It was a gorgeous drink to look at (florescent white floating on a bed of deep rose) and had a subtle kick. I didn't really care for the desserts (I had the panna cotta - great texture but odd yogurt-like flavor flavor), but that was a minor thing. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere is like being in a dance club minus the heavy bass (mood lighting, Day-Glo light accents, nice looking but slightly uncomfortable furniture). I've been before for cocktails and liked it (pricey though they are at $15 a pop), but now I think I may work a dinner outing or two in. If you aren't convinced yet, then know the W is one of the prime people watching spots in SOMA. Have a before dinner drink in the lounge and you will come away with at least one story to tell your grand-kids - or at least your girlfriends the next time you see them.
author: Nicole M.

description: Overpriced, club like atmosphere when all I want is something to eat.
author: Sally L.

description: There's something about a place that has neon purple lights...like the place is trying to be cool and swanky. Sometimes a lounge can pull it off, but Trace fell a bit too short of that. It ended up feeling like an out dated spot where it was the-place-to-be 5 years ago. Happy Hour was decent, not the best. It was pretty quiet the day I went with only some business men lingering after a long day in the office. The bartender was really friendly, perhaps since there weren't a whole lot of other patrons for him to talk to or serve. I was disappointed since Trace is fairly close to my office- but I guess I'll have to keep looking for my go-to HH spot.
author: Christine A.

description: Came here for brunch with a Travelzoo voucher. Service was terrible. After the food was given, the waiter ignored my requests for much needed condiments for the bland, overpriced, subpar food. The waiter did not even ask how the food tasted!  1 star for the strong,  tasty cocktails.
author: Maylene C.

description: Amazing meal! Every dish was cooked to perfection, the flavors were beyond my expectation and the staff was great - especially Shawn - he's awesome! Definitely order the Brussels sprouts, and the glaze on the salmon is incredible. The fact that they're sustainable makes Trace a 5 star restaurant.
author: Julia M.

description: Went there on a sat while they were hosting a Stanford grad party. Not the right choice of nice I tell you. I think I had bottle service by the dj. And giving him 20 dollars just to play my song is probably understandable. The atmosphere was great and it's a nice place to dress up and enjoy your weekend.
author: Lisa Z.

description: Good modern ambience. Courteous greeter and server but the water/bread server was a little intrusive. Most of all, I wasn't happy at all with the food I had. For that, I won't be coming back here again, and can't recommend it to anyone either.
author: Straight N.

description: So my girlfriends and I came here for a livingsocial type deal. It was actually really tasty. Brunch with a twist, accompanied with coconut water, a cocktail and an entree. I had a chocolate chip waffle with bacon. YUM. We pretty much tried one of each entree and we weren't disappointed. Most memorable: a pizza with pickled carrots? I can't remember but it was super interesting! Service was great, our waiter was attentive but not hovering. Cute little swanky place, maybe on the brink of pretentious, but wtv.
author: Camille T.

description: Love the chill ambiance, modern furniture and LED bar. This is BART-able, or you can park at the Moscone garage. Of course, they have valet, too. This won't be your cheapest night out, but if you don't mind spending a little extra cheddar for ambiance, this is the spot.
author: Karen Z.

description: Went here awhile back with a group from work.  I must admit the upgrades at The W Hotel are nice and swanky but it's as if I'm at a club.  I personally like the look and decor prior to the renovation.  The menu is limited, mostly pork and red meat dishes and I don't eat babe or moo.  I ordered the grilled salmon, it was really my only choice on the menu.  However, it  was very good.  Before our entrees came, the group ordered a few of the flat bread appetizers.  I heard our server say it was the pork belly.  I  said to my coworker sitting next to me that I will pass, I don't eat pork.  The server over heard me and asked if she could bring something out for me.  I told her that is was fine and can wait for my entree.  Well 10 mins later she came over to me with  a bowl of their homemade potato chips and thyme dip.  I thought that was very kind and thoughtful of her.  All in all, the restaurant has excellent service and the food was very good. The cocktails are insanely good. However,  with the limited options and pricey menu; I have to give a 3 rating.
author: Liz D.

description: Decent food packaged in the usual chic W hotel package.  Basically the same interior as XYZ (Lots of white on white furniture).  Typical hot, vacuous hostess and semi-friendly hip robotic servers.  Had lunch here twice.  Good food, but nothing to write home about.  They're doing the trendy farm-to-table menu, blah, blah blah.  Prices are better than the former XYZ. I have to give them that. Stop by for an ok experience, but don't expect to be wowed.
author: Shane C.

description: Amazing brunch - eggs chilaqueles and carrot waffles were really really good. Waitress went above and beyond, getting us Nutella and caramel sauce for the waffles.  Just one visit and Trace is now our go-to brunch place in SOMA!
author: Aditya A.

description: This place is a great addition to the soma neighborhood!  Seasonal ingredients and their menu changes frequently enough so a local is never bored.  Loved their salmon with pea risotto, and the halibut crudo with green dressing is delish!  Very friendly service, and a great wine/beverage selection.  Brunch is good, but dinner is my favorite!
author: Rebecca W.

description:
For appetizers we had the Miyagi oysters with red wine mignonette and horseradish creme fraiche- tender, briny and succulent. Chicken liver mouse with quince jam and crostini- silky smooth mousse with ultra crunchy crostini and I'm officially in love with quince jam.
 
For mains, we had the seared scallops with celery root, charred cauliflower, chanterelles and capers- buttery and perfectly cooked, although the portion was a tad miserly. Beef filet with roasted maitake mushrooms, broccoli rabe and potato puree- the filet was also well cooked but it was evident the plate had been sitting under the heating lamp as the restaurant was very quiet.
 
For dessert we shared the pot de creme bar. A very creamy, decidedly caramel-ly bar on graham cracker crust with guiness ice cream and a crumble that was more rice krispie-ish.
 
The vibe- urban, hip, spacious, clean, austere with loud house music filtering in through the lobby. The W knows its target demographic and it's definitely geared towards the young, urban professional with a stylish bent.

Service was very attentive as the restaurant was quite empty as we had an early reservation on a friday night. It did start to get busy later. Our server, a Russian girl was very sweet and gave good reccommendations. Even the hostess Ryoku was lovely.
author: Chris H.

description: Had the fried chicken twice there--both times everyone at the table thought it was best dish.  All breast meat, with a jalapeño kick to it.  Don't be fooled by the fact that it's in a hotel. It's awesome!
author: Fred J.

description: Trace will always be XYZ to me.  However, their burger does not measure up to XYZ.  Don't get me wrong its good, but XYZ's burgers were much better and slightly bigger w/real bacon strips.  Traces homemade chips are tasty if you chose instead of french fries.
author: Rich W.

description:
Decided to try brunch after purchasing a Travelzoo deal. My husband and I tried some dinner items at the bar when it first opened and really enjoyed the dishes.

We arrived hoping to sit outside but their two sidewalk tables had just been sat. Host let us pick our table which we appreciated. We sat and we waited, waited and waited. After about 15 minutes of no one stopping by our table my husband was ready to leave. I convinced him to give the bar a try-I was starving! Right after we sat a busser came over and apologized, indicating some emergency was going on in the kitchen. He also brought sunglasses my husband had forgot on the table.

We informed bartender we had the Travelzoo voucher and asked what that included. He did not know. Another bartender was brought over and took our order. They were brunch items paired with cocktails. He let us swap drinks which was great. Bloody Mary's were tasty. I've had better but these were fine, lots of veggies which I enjoyed. We then waited, waited and waited . . . Long after my drink was gone breakfast arrived, steak and eggs. The steak was tasty, medium rare as requested, and the eggs well cooked. 

When it came time to pay our server brought by the bill, acknowledging the lengthy wait time, comping one of our meals and offering to let us use our voucher another time; without that gesture we would not have been back despite the quality of the food. We took him up on the offer and are hoping the service will be quicker on our next trip.
author: Kim M.

description: This used to be XYZ in the W Hotel.  It was douchy back then and after the remodel, its still douchy.  I'm sure everyone that hangs out here is visiting on business and possibly looking for a one nighter. One thing that is nicer than before is that there's more space than before and the seating area is nice.  I like the bar top because its white and clean looking. I like that it changes colors too.  Just adds a more lively feel.  Wasn't a fan of the food they served.  They served something they called a duck banh mi.  There was nothing in it that even represented a banh mi. Crab cakes were good with the mint chutney. The uncooked tomato soup just tasted like a thicker version of V8.  I doubt I would come back here because I dont like this kind of crowd it has and the drinks are expensive. Has to be one or the other, not both.
author: Gina S.

description: Top notch restaurant and staff all the way around!   The lamb meatballs were devine and the filet was perfectly cooked!  We deferred to the wine sommellier to pair the wine with courses and the choices were spot on!  Don't miss the avacodo icecream with ricotta based cheesecake dessert!  Yummm!  Very well run operation and a great balance between price and quality with a splash of classy thrown in!
author: David C.

description:
There I was, deep undercover in the cesspool of corrupt swindlers, precarious lies, and shocking lack of charisma known as the Game Developer's Conference (GDC) in San Francisco. While I can't remember how I ended up there with the alias of Pip Tiddlywinks, mutton-chopped philanthropist and avant-garde board game designer, I do recall that we suspected our next lead in the Case of the Missing Papaya Diamond to be present. But where? Ay, there's the rub. 
I found myself nursing an Afternoon Delight in Trace, a swanky restaurant part of the W Hotel, and cleaning Bangers, my trusty magnifying glass. It's not that peculiar of a name, really: Upon discovering a clue I tend to exclaim "Bangers!" rather loudly, so it practically named itself.
The atmosphere in Trace resembled that of a bloated Virgin Airlines cabin mid-flight, aesthetics and loud, non-descript noise included. I was finishing off the drink when the bird walked in, graceful, elegant, and dressed to tighten my trousers. Yes, she was the lead in our case. I still remember her beautiful smile, flowing strands of golden hair, lips only reserved for angels, hypnotizing eyes, and that the duck item on the menu was accompanied by pickled quince. What the bloody hell is quince? We ordered our respective meals without mentioning a word to each other. Once the waiter chap was off to the kitchen, the game was afoot.  After a brief silence, she started to speak in a voice that would enchant even the most chivalrous of gentlemen: "Detective Honeybutter. I need your help." It was at this point that the chap placed my plate before me and I stopped listening. 
The wild fennel pollen fettuccine with braised lamb shank was rather exquisite. While I feel that the portion was appropriate for a five course meal, there were no other courses included. Here's a tip when ordering this dish then: Claim the bread basket and dip those spoils of war in the lamb concoction. It lengthens the culinary experience without sacrificing the charm of the dish. During the meal, the waiter chap kept asking if we were done when I was not. Not by any stretch of the imagination.  Upon the fourth attempt to steal my plate, I was ready to engage in award-winning fisticuffs and made it clear: "Just because I'm British doesn't mean I want to go colonize your bloody kitchen with my dirty plates, my good sir!". He backed down after that, as well he should have. 
But it was the dessert that sealed Trace's fate. I ordered the Panna Cotta on recommendation from the now-emasculated waiter, but let me describe, in essence, what I was served: Imagine that a tiny glob of whipped cream from a larger, more dominant dessert fell off and the chef was so ashamed he tried to hide it under a small, single tangerine slice. Yes, quite. I was about to confirm my disappointment when I looked up and realized the bird was gone.
The plot had thickened. It was time to bring my partner, B. Wellington, in on the case. What, you have never heard of "Honeybutter and the Wellington"? What is this, amateur hour? Upon further investigation of her plate (i.e. rummaging through to see if there was any duck left), I found a scribbled note addressed to me.
Bangers!


The Case of the Missing Papaya Diamond will continue in the next entry.
author: Brevin P.

description: Pretty solid place.  Had the scallops (came with noodles) that were good and a beet salad that was great (couldve used more arugula) with some oysters and fried quail for appetizers.  Possibly more of a 4 star but didn't blow me away (especially for the price).  Definitely still a good spot downtown!
author: Michael K.

description: I had breakfast here: my omelette was dry and a poached egg order was hard boiled, not poached. Plus, the prices are quite high for the low quality food prep. Go next door to the St. Regis or another neighborhood option.
author: Michael C.

description: Love this place! Very hip and modern. The Gnoochi is one of the best I have EVER had... they actually crisp it just a tad to add on to the great texture and soak it in the pork fat juice (sounds horrible but tastes so darn good) Damien our server was AMAZING also! We felt like we had known him for years. Def will come back if I am in the area. Oh.. we came in for lunch.. so it was not crowded which was perfect.
author: Liz O.

description: My boyfriend and I moved to SF from NY about a year ago and have been looking for a place that replicates the same fun energy as some of the NY restaurants we visited.  We found this in Trace.  LOVE that is is open late for dinner and the whole vibe inside the W Hotel is sexy, loud, fun.  Our server Roger was amazing - attentive, great with recos, personable.  The food was fantastic, I love that you can get a few smaller plates to share and try a variety if you'd like.  Can't go wrong with the meatballs.  We stayed after dinner to hang out in the bar.  Overall, it was a fantastic date night and we'll definitely come back.  I will warn that we are late-20's and like louder, funkier places for dinner.  I would not suggest this for someone who is looking for a traditional romantic dinner.
author: Amy D.

description: My wife and I enjoyed our pre valentines day dinner here.  We arrived at 7 pm on a Saturday.  There was a moderate crowd and noise level was moderate.  We experienced excellent service and a great meal.  My wife started with the beet salad while enjoyed some yellow tail tuna slices.  Both of our entrees, duck and scallops, were delicious.  Portion sizes were perfect leaving us neither hungry or stuffed.  The service additionally included a nice selection of breads frequently brought to the table.  We were fortunate to get a table near the wall so we were out of the way.  I don't think we would have enjoyed the more cafeteria-like seating in the center of the main eating area.
author: Ed P.

description: Enjoyed dinner here. Loud atmosphere. Great concept of using organic and local fare. Enjoyed the duck breast and heirloom tomato salad. The tuna tartar was excellent.
author: Erik M.

description: I loved this place, it's trendy but not over done. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. Dinner for 8 including wine will cost one month's mortgage payment so be forewarned.
author: Lorena D.

description: Very modern decor. We were half an hour late for our reservation, yet they were accomodating. Service was excellent: attentive without being overbearing, and friendly. Food: had the beet salad, which was excellent, the salmon, which simply melted in the mouth, and the steak, which was alright, but the garnish was a bit much. Would totally recommend the place.
author: Ehtesham K.

description: Trace is located on the first floor of the W Hotel. I wouldn't bring a date here but for a vendor lunch it is okay. The food and service are average, but the restrooms are on the second floor by XYZ. I would probably only come back here if I was attending a Conference at Moscone and needed a somewhere to sit for a quick lunch.
author: Benzee B.

description: I didn't realize the XYZ had been replaced by 'Trace.'  So instead of the black decor, dark lighting it transformed into white, more lighting, Scandinavian-esque lounge?  Hmm...if it were a Scandinavian lounge they'd at least been some attractive vikings or such...anyhow we didn't eat at the restaurant, but ordered food at the bar.  They use to have great bar food of margaritha pizza, burger and fries...but with the change it seems they've changed their menus and the food is a bit lacking...what hasn't changed is their SLOW, SLOW and did I mention SLOW service and staff with attitudes!
author: Mao K.

description: I didn't eat here, but they have Pappy Van Winkle...in a hotel lobby! Oh and the scene isn't bad...maybe we'll get food here.
author: G C.

description: The BF called to reserve a quiet table for us.  When we arrived, there was a strong bleach smell as we walked in.  Then, the hostess tried to seat us in a partitioned off area less than 12 inches from another table with diners.  We had specifically requested a quiet table, out of the way.  Fail.  We then were seated at a table in the middle of the restaurant and we decided to just sit down.  The whole place is decorated in white and gray and the tables are VERY close together.  It felt cold.  Literally and figuratively.  There was just no ambiance!  We both gave each other sour faces, got up and left.  Between the bleach smell and stark, sterile white decor, this place really feels like a hospital cafeteria.  Too bad.
author: Lanette F. G.

description: My wife and I spent a Saturday night in the city to see some friends from out of town. We stayed at the W as we have on other occasions. We wanted to get some breakfast before we headed back down to Sunnyvale. There is not a lot of food choices in this part of SF, so we decided to just eat at the hotel restaurant, Trace. What a complete waste of time and money. We were seated right away in the cramped and uncomfortably close dinning room. The problems started almost as soon as we sat down. The hostess asked what we wanted to drink. My wife asked for orange juice and wanted a coffee with cream and a tomato juice. She returned about 5 minutes later with the orange juice and the coffee. No creamer and not my tomato juice. I waited, thinking they would be coming any second now. Nope. I had to flag down a bus boy and ask for cream. I never did get my juice. I would say we sat there, waiting to have someone take our order for at least 15 minutes. The only reason we did get to finally order is because the waitress came to give the bill to the table behind us. It was only they she saw us there, menus in hand, waiting. She acted surprised to see us there. We ordered and waited again, this time for 20 minutes. Finally the food came. I had the Chilaquiles and my wife ordered the breakfast sandwich which had a diced ham gravy. When the food came, both dishes were stone cold. Her breakfast potatoes looked like they had been dipped in batter and then deep fried. Very unappetizing.  My wife took 1 bite of the gravy covered sandwich and said, that's it, I'm not eating this. The waitress never did come back, even to bring us the bill. I had to ask another waiter as he was passing to bring me the check. All this for a mere $47 dollars. Needless to say, we will not be dinning at the Trace any time soon.
author: Chad H.

description:
Stayed at the W a couple weeks ago and I normally never eat at the hotel, but this weekend I took a chance. Had breakfast on day 2 and it was good, but pretty pricey for eggs and bacon. Service was friendly and helpful.

Now for round 2 we came back for dinner the next night. Atmosphere is very cool and hip here (it IS the W) and we were seated promptly. The popcorn soup was really tasty. Unfortunately that's about the only good part for this night. We ordered a bottle of wine but our server recommended something "better" that would be around $80 a bottle. I figured, what the heck it's SF. After pouring our glasses, he mentioned that he had made a mistake on the price and it's a little bit more...$140 to be exact. Well, the dude was smart to pour the bottle first, since it's not like we can pour it back. He apologized and said to take it out of his tip (dude sure thought we were a generous bunch to tip him $60...).  Now onto the rest of the meal, it doesn't get any better. All 3 of us in the party ordered the Rib Eye medium rare...they all came out well done. We sent 2 back (one guy doesn't know steaks) and they came back pretty rare, but at least they knew to take the steak off sooner than before. $38 a ribeye too. They comped us dessert and coffee for the steak mishap, but our server definitely didn't tell anyone he screwed us big time on the wine. I won't be back but that's ok, live and learn. I guess it helps to throw a fit if you're that kind of person.
author: Mark H.

description: A-Maz-ing!!! The braised pork shoulder with crisp gnocchi, mushroom and pecorino is to die for. So good we ordered a second round of it. Great, friendly service, Joe is awesome! Open late and has a super trendy but inviting atmosphere. We'll be back for sure!
author: Seth M.

description: We had the four course Xmas day menu with wine pairing. Each course was delicious and the service was good.
author: Jaime P.

description:
As suburbanites, my wife and i have almost become tourists in the City that we each used to live in.  Hence, since we are in San Francisco so infrequently, we try to make sure we make something special of our evenings there.  We had a Travelzoo coupon for the prix fixe dinner for two at Trace.  I can't say enough about the entire experience.  First of all, each course came with a choice of three adult beverages.  The night we were there, one could choose from an exquisite lemongrass drop, a very good pinot noir, and a whiskey-based liqueur with walnut liqueur and bitters named a Mr. Robinson.  I had one of each and each hit the spot.  Not only were the choices on the prix fixe menu good, they allowed reasonable substitutions from the regular menu.  I started with a beet and goat cheese plate accompanied by tasty flat bread.  I'm not a foodie, so i can't describe each element in the dish, but both my wife and I were wowed.  My wife started with a pumpkin  soup that was totally satisfying.  I then had the slow-cooked Berkshire pork loin. My wife had the roasted chicken breast.  I usually like a dark or fruity sauce on pork. While the pork loin came with a light sauce that would have left a less than perfectly cooked pork loin flavorless, that was not the case here.  The subtle seasoning  was perfect, particularly with the earthy pinot noir and the lentils were delicious.  It is always dangerous to order chicken breast because it can be either bland or dry.  Again, this was not the case.  My wife loved the chicken breast, it was juicy and the kale and pistachio aigre doux complimented the chicken, adding just the right touch.  For dessert we both had the chocolate creme bar.  It was the perfect ending to the meal,, I'm not much of a dark liquor person, but the Mr. Robinson went quite well with the dessert.

Apart from the food, the experience was perfect, the place feels at once hip SOMA, romantic and comfortable, the service and attention received from the staff was magnificent, my wife and i had the sort of experience that reminded us of how lucky we are to live so close to such a great city.  We will definitely go back to Trace, knowing that any dinner there will feel like a special occasion.  Thank you Trace for making this experience available through Travelzoo, and thank you Travelzoo for all the great experiences you've provided us with.
author: Eric S.

description: Food was delicious and my husband is hard to please.  We dined on Travel Zoo coupon and I hope they have another one as I will try the other items featured for Travel Zoo patrons and even if I don't have a coupon I will certainly visit again.   The service was excellent and the waiter knew how to pair our food with some excellent wines.  Thank you again for a wonderful and memorable night of dining.
author: Mimi L.

description: Celebrated my bday dinner here with some great friends.  TRACE was so deelish.  I felt like I was having the most decadent of dining experiences.  The chef (Paul Piscopo) is so talented and accommodating.  He took his already creative dishes and made vegetarian versions for us...while keeping the taste and flavor all packed in there.  We noticed a lot of tables for two, so this must be a great date night place.  However, we were three moms having a fun night out and were able to eat 5 courses of amazing food, while sampling a variety of wine and talking and laughing the entire time.  We couldn't have asked for better ambiance, food, or service.  TRACE rocks!!
author: Tracy B.

description: Some friends and I had brunch here the other day, and checked out the new "Remix" menu. The new prix fixe brunch options were de-lish! Bacon and cocoa nibs in the waffle?! Breakfast pizza?! YUM. And the fresh juice options for the bellinis, were wonderful. I ordered the Egg Chilaquiles, and was very impressed. It had just the right amount of spice, and a the queso fresco topping it off, was superb. Would definitely order it again. The DJ played some really fun, old school mash-ups. Next time you and some friends are looking to "Remix" your weekend brunch, definitely check out TRACE!
author: MacKenzie F.

description:
Food is pretty good. 

The interiors are terrible! This is what happens when you hire an Architect to do an Interior Designer's job. You feel like you're inside of a computer. Its loud. There is no definition between restaurant and bar. The furniture is so square and boxy it uncomfortable. The barstools were so uncomfortable that I had to keep my feet propped the entire lunch just so I didn't fall off the stool. I'm 5'-4" and the backs of my knees didn't even come close to the edge of the seat. This is an unfortunate design FAIL.
author: Jenn S.

description: Had an incredible dinner here last weekend.  Everything was very fresh, wonderful sauces but very light.  Had an incredible pasta dish with fresh peas, lemon zest and crunchy breadcrumbs.  Yum!  Our waiter, Roger was so helpful in paring our wines and gave us some great insight for our trip to Napa the next day.  Will definitely be back to Trace next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Pauline M.

description:
This review is going to be absolutely scathing, and I am sorry for that. Mostly I am sorry for the chef  (Paul Piscopo) who is clearly very talented as well the wait staff who are quite attentive and capable. 

This restaurant has absolutely NO business being open.  I feel misled and cheated out of $280 and I hope whoever owns this place either a) starts to take reviews like this to heart, b) closes up so the chef and staff can go work somewhere worthy of their skills OR c)  advertises what the restaurant really is and does not pretend to be something that it is not in order to lure in more upscale patrons like us. I wish I could file a claim for false advertising and get my money back! Maybe the general manager will read this review and take note.   

I frequented xyz  (the restaurant in this same location) many times in the past before attending an event at SF MOMA or Yerba Buena Center; and I always had a nice experience and assumed by it's location (as well as it's very misleading website) that the ambience at Trace would be similar with it's farm fresh food, warm and welcoming photos on it's website about visits to organic farms, and a "thoughtful culinary atmosphere" (a direct quote from their website). WRONG!  

OMG, the four of us walked in to the restaurant and were immediately hit with the loudest and the most obnoxious canned techno music I have ever heard. I like to dance and move my booty as much as the next person; but this music was just dreadful, and I felt like I was in the middle of a very bad dream that I really wanted to wake up from.  The restaurant is right next to a very loud and very crowded bar. and there is NO soundproofing at all - no  doorway to separate the two, no rugs, no drapes, no fabrics, nothing at all.  The restaurant is just one big 23rd century fantasy of what 'might' be cool if the Star Trek Enterprise opened a restaurant. It was just a caricature of itself and all the furnishing were cold, un welcoming and completely non functional. My husband is an Architect and it took him and one of our friends all of 10 minutes to assess the situation and to come up with some solutions. So my assumption is that the owners also knew what could be done to fix the situation and chose their own grandiose ideas with clearly no regard for the restaurant patrons. But back to the music: the techno music was thumping on our ears the ENTIRE time with a beat that brings to mind water dripping/nails on a chalkboard; and at such decibels that you want to run screaming from the room.  

So naturally my first reaction was to order a bottle of wine to dull the pain, and here was shock #2.  I was offended any restaurant in SF would offer such a poor selection of wines with these absurd prices. I believe the lowest price bottle of wine was $60, most of them were between $70 and $90 (some were $300 and $400) and almost none of these wines were even remotely qualified to be selling at those prices. I have eaten in many fine restaurants with extensive and very high quality wine lists that offer way more diversity in price and choice than this list.  Frankly, the wine experience just felt exploitative, and I think the owner (or whomever makes these decisions) should be called out as clearly they are just trying to make a buck at our expense.

When I walked around the restaurant to see if any other tables were even remotely quieter (they were not) it was sad to see other patrons having the same experience as we were and talking to their waiters asking for the music to please stop. Make it stop!  Unfortunately nothing could or would be done. So I am writing this review for the half dozen other tables I saw with equally unpleasant experiences. 

And if I had to do it all over again I would have left the restaurant;  and in our limited time before the ballet, walked down the street to find somewhere, anywhere else to eat. 

And again sincere apologies to the chef, who as I mentioned at the top of this review, is clearly very good and the poor wait staff who must have to take a valium before coming to work just to get through the experience. They all get an "A" for effort.
author: Kristine H.

description: food was ok.  service was pretty good, considering our large party.
author: Tina F.

description: While staying at the W hotel for 12 days I visited Trace often because it's in the lobby. I ordered the same menu items: Albacore Tartare (a small plate of tartare with melba style toast served with a salad with apple slices mixed in and a vinaigrette dressing. I liked it but I didn't love it mainly because the tartare was served room temperature. I also had lunch there a few times and ordered the veggie burger which was absolutely amazing! Very huge...the kind of burger you need to cut in half or you need large hands to hold. The veggie patty was very thick and juicy. It was served with a pickle slice, and shoe string fries. I was stuffed after eating only half. I thought it was pretty expensive but not much different than other casual places in the area. Hell! The convention center across three street charges $12 for a salad! No thanks! I would rather eat at Trace. Also a pretty nice atmosphere with sofas, fireplace, and candles lit throughout. Gets pretty crowded in the evening and the staff it's very nice.
author: Melli B.

description: Can't review it because I couldn't eat there.  Have a high profile client in town and made the reservation (during Oracle Open World) to eat there for lunch today (made the reservation last week).  The woman today said they had no record of it.  Can't find another restaurant - all booked...., really screwed up my day....................
author: Eric R.

description: Great modern ambiance.  Their Chicken Liver Mousse makes me not miss Foie Gras as much, and another classic is their Pan Seared Sea Bass.  I do miss their Beet Salad, which I hope they return to the menu again.
author: T T.

description: Nope. Nope. A thousand times Nope. I was invited to Trace at the W-SF for a media-rep lunch. The menu was, frankly, limited... and a tad boring. So I went for the burger, medium-rare. Round 1 came out medium+, so I sent it back. Round 2 came out medium-well, and didn't even reach the table until my colleagues were done with their meals. What can I say but, "Fail."
author: P W.

description:
excellent food.
just remember if it's not priced on the menu it's going to be vary expansive.
(Late for 6$) :(
author: roy b.

description: LOVE the burger. I do love a good burger and these guys have it figured out. Trace is a great part of the W Hotel. I work in the neighborhood and frequent this place.  The food is wonderful compliments of chef Paul and his team. I am also impressed with the customer service. I like to request Kim's section being that she knows whats up with the wine and food details. Thank you Trace for giving the SOMA another great spot to visit! You guys Rock!
author: Lou F.
